Parse and convert geographic coordinates

Source: R/geocoords.R
geocoords_parse.Rd

Parse coordinate strings in various formats (MGRS, UTM, DMS) and convert between representations.

geocoords_parse(x)

geocoords_to_mgrs(x, precision = 5L)

geocoords_to_utm(x, precision = 0L)

Arguments

x

Character vector of coordinate strings to parse, or for conversion functions a two-column matrix of (longitude, latitude).

precision

Integer precision for output strings (0-11 for MGRS).

Value

  • geocoords_parse(): Data frame with columns lat, lon, zone, northp, easting, northing, convergence, scale

  • geocoords_to_mgrs(): Character vector of MGRS strings

  • geocoords_to_utm(): Character vector of UTM/UPS strings

Details

The geocoords_parse() function accepts various input formats:

  • MGRS codes: "33TWN0500049000", "33T 505000 4900000"

  • UTM: "33N 505000 4900000"

  • DMS: "44d 0' 0\" N 33d 0' 0\" E"

  • Decimal: "44.0 33.0"

Examples

# Parse MGRS
geocoords_parse("33TWN0500049000")
#>        lat      lon zone northp  easting northing convergence     scale
#> 1 47.39444 15.06626   33   TRUE 505000.5  5249000  0.04877177 0.9996003

# Parse UTM
geocoords_parse("33N 505000 4900000")
#>        lat      lon zone northp easting northing convergence     scale
#> 1 44.25322 15.06263   33   TRUE  505000  4900000  0.04370603 0.9996003

# Convert to MGRS
geocoords_to_mgrs(cbind(lon = c(147, -74), lat = c(-42, 40)))
#> [1] "55GEP00000000005022377518" "18TWK85360461842823606463"
